Posts.Content: Sep 4, 2018 10:36PM kista wrote: I’m not much help because I’m still in the waiting stage too. But usually irregular size isn’t a good sign from what I read. I’m just responding cuz nobody really responded to mine and I really hoped for some input Hope your test results come quickly. My biopsy is Friday.
Posts.Title: Need support and info kikibird kikibird

Posts.Content: kista wrote: In early June we found out my older sister (age 39) has BC early July we found out she’s Metastatic as its spread to her spine and sternum. Of course my family decided everyone needed to go get a mammogram. My mom came back clear, my sister came back clear. I got a call early last week after my 3D mammogram saying they wanted me to come back for an ultrasound. I was on vacation when they called and scheduled it for Wednesday thinking it was just my first mammogram and they didn’t have anything to compare to. In the meantime they posted the report, “Possble 11mm spiculated left breast upper outer quadrant nodule in mid one third depth.” After googling all that stuff I’m thinking my odds aren’t great of being cancer free. I haven’t said anything to my mom as she’s having a hard enough time dealing with my sisters recent diagnosis. I’ve discussed with my hubby a bit but he thinks I’m being paranoid. Just want everyone’s real thoughts and want to be realistic. Dx 9/11/2018, ILC, Left, 1cm, Stage IA, Grade 2, ER+/PR+, HER2- (IHC) Surgery 10/4/2018 Prophylactic mastectomy: Right Surgery 10/4/2018 Lymph node removal: Sentinel; Mastectomy: Left Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: 37 with Spiculated Mass-Sister is Metastatic kista kista

Posts.Content: Sep 27, 2018 10:15AM kista wrote: I’m 37 and having a bilateral mastectomy a week from today. I don’t have a huge long family history; but mine is short and recent. My sister (age 39) was diagnosed with stage 4 exactly 3 months before I was diagnosed (the only reason I know about mine is her Genetic Councilor telling her to have her sisters checked). She tested negative for the gene (mine is still pending). I chose bilateral mastectomy for a few reasons. 1) Obviously having a sister diagnosed at stage 4 makes me want to do everything I can to avoid a recourrence. I know had she been given that option she’s surely take it over her diagnosis any day. 2) I know it will always be there making me check worrying me & stressing me out. 3) My surgeon said while they may they may the same after recon reconstruction; they won’t age the same. 4) Having ILC puts me at a higher risk for other cancers & ILC likes to hide on imaging. Best of luck on whatever you choose. It’s just a personal choice. I very hard personal choice
